tagline: CTO & CIO at European Broadcasting Union
summary:
CTO & CIO at the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) with an extensive experience in conceiving, developing and taking new products and services to market. Since joining EBU, I launched several initiatives leveraging the collective expertise of the EBU Membership enabling the digital transformation of public service media(PSM), exploiting advances in data science, production and transmission technologies, while strengthening the collaboration of PSM with European policy initiatives, start-ups and academic institutions.
The most recent initiatives are the launch of the Eurovox project and of the 5G Media Action Group (5G-MAG).
The EuroVox project is an open platform leveraging AI technologies, delivering language services for media.
The 5G-MAG is a global industry association designed to transform 5G standards in operational services for media production and distribution, using a multilayer approach combining broadcast and unicast services sustainably serving 100% of the population and of any territory;

I have managed teams working on digital TV, satellite communications, IP-based services, artificial intelligence and mobile communications, being internationally recognized expert on those topics, with strong knowledge of the European market working closely with the leading players in the media, telecoms and academic fields, and with European institutions at a technical, standardization, regulatory and competition level.
I have also participated in the launch of the first GSM services and responsible for launching the first digital TV services in Europe; playing a central role in the convergence between the broadcasting and the internet in the mid 90‚Äôs with the launch of the DVB-IP set of standards;developing disruptive ideas being translated into new products and commercial services in the satellite sector;
I was previously Director of Innovation and a Member of the Management Committee at Eutelsat taking part in key phases of its development from an international organization to privatization in 2001 and to the IPO in 2005.
Before joining Eutelsat, I worked for the European Space Agency, and prior to that, for Telespazio and Selenia Spazio.
I am Chair of the 5G-MAG, Chair of the ETSI JTC on Broadcasting and a founding member of the Digital Video Broadcasting (DVB) project.
I am today managing a team of highly qualified and passionate experts at EBU. I own a Doctorate in Electronics & Telecommunications Engineering from the University of Pisa and I am also owning 20 patents. Fluent in Italian, English and French.

summary: Hi! I‚Äôm Kevin, VP AdTech at Dailymotion, overseeing product and engineering for our SSP. summary:
For more than three decades, I‚Äôve been involved, shaping and supporting photojournalism, helping tell the world‚Äôs stories through powerful images, from conflict zones and natural disasters to elections and the everyday moments that define who we are.

Today, as AFP‚Äôs Photo Director for North America, I lead an extraordinary team of photographers and editors covering some of the most consequential events in the United States and beyond.

My journey with AFP has taken me across four continents - from Latin America to the Middle East, Asia, and now the U.S. Each chapter has reinforced my belief in the power of visual journalism to inform, connect, and hold truth to light.

As technology reshapes our industry, I‚Äôm committed to ensuring that trust remains at the heart of visual journalism. I‚Äôm now turning my attention to a new chapter of visual journalism: image authentication and digital trust. Together with our teams and partners, we‚Äôre building tools that safeguard the credibility of our work - ensuring people can trust what they see in an age of AI and misinformation.

I believe in the power of photography to inform, connect, inspire - and in supporting the next generation of photojournalists to do the same. Always open to conversations around visual storytelling, innovation, and ethics in journalism.

tagline:
Tech Entrepreneur, Lecturer, Author and Speaker at TED Conferences - 
My 1st book  on "How the philosophy of AI can help us transform" is OUT !
summary:
I am a tech entrepreneur, lecturer, author, columnist, and TED speaker, passionate about shaping a human-centered future with Artificial Intelligence. 

After four years working in London‚Äôs financial markets, I chose to build something more ethical and meaningful. That‚Äôs how I founded Bionoor, a pioneering social enterprise rooted in sustainability and fair trade, operating between France, Algeria, and across Europe, Africa, and Asia. 

A decade later, I returned to my technological roots and created BIGmama Technology. With BIGmama and our flagship product Hyko.ai, I design AI platforms and intelligent agents that amplify human expertise and creativity ‚Äî never to replace them. 

As a writer and public speaker ‚Äî contributing to Les √âchos, appearing on BFM Business, teaching at Sciences Po Paris, and sharing my vision on the TED stage ‚Äî I explore a constant red thread: how AI can transform our lives, our work, and our societies for the better. My latest book, Super-Papillon (Rio Bravo, 2025), prefaced by Alexandre Jardin, develops this vision, presenting AI as a kind of ‚ÄúSuper-Socrates‚Äù that can help us question, grow, and reinvent ourselves in an age of hybrid intelligence. 

What drives me is disruption with purpose. At the crossroads of innovation, philosophy, and social impact, I work to inspire individuals and organizations to embrace technology not as a replacement, but as a force for autonomy, creativity, and human growth.

tagline: Co-founder Chairman and CEO Baracoda Group
summary:
Thomas Serval is the CEO and co-founder of Baracoda Group and their subsidiaries: Kolibree, CareOS, Radioline

With over 20 years of experience starting and running companies in three continents, Thomas‚Äô expertise involves all aspects of assessing disruptive technologies, creating new businesses, fundraising, growth, and developing new markets or partnerships. With Baracoda Group, Thomas has focused on cutting-edge tech products ever since his first venture in connected objects: a Bluetooth barcode scanner released in 2001. 

After successfully exiting Baracoda in 2008, Thomas had the chance to work as an executive manager for both Microsoft and Google. At both companies he ran projects related to strategic deal negotiations and business development, managing business with European media and  telecommunication groups. Under his leadership, Google‚Äôs revenue was multiplied 3x on his product lines.

Later, Thomas came home to Baracoda, rejoining as CEO to develop the brand and further its global reach. Applying what he learned working for industry giants, he‚Äôs managed to launch such game-changers as his line of connected toothbrushes with Colgate and a series of smart-mirror connected products in 2019. With his input and visionary leadership, Baracoda has built a strong relationship with the world‚Äôs biggest leaders in their respective industries. A shortlist of his major collaborators includes Colgate, Pierre Fabre and Wella. 

As a graduate of the Ecole Normale Sup√©rieure and the Ecole Nationale de la Statistique et de l‚ÄôAdministration Economique (ENSAE), Thomas is heavily involved with schools, startups and incubators ‚Äî a major part of the French innovation community. He currently sits as  a State Representative at the board  of ARTE France (a European Public Television Service that produces cultural programs). During the academic year, he‚Äôs a regular lecturer at top French institutions such as ESCP, ESSEC, HEC, Telecom Paris and Corps des Mines. In 2017, he was invited at Stanford University to speak about how he created the connected oral care consumer product category.

Counting 77  patents and ten CES Innovation Awards under his belt, Thomas was sworn into the Legion of Honor by the French President in 2018. Today, he‚Äôs focused on partnerships and product launches aiming to create a daily healthtech ecosystem. He‚Äôs working to turn all the key tenets of his smart bathroom vision into a reality.

tagline: Documentary producer and presenter at Euronews TV
summary:
Denis Loctier is an international TV journalist and video producer with a strong passion for visual storytelling. His programmes are filmed worldwide and released in more than 10 languages, reaching audiences in over 160 countries.

With more than 25 years of experience in television, Denis has led crews through deserts and wetlands, faced Arctic conditions, and explored the depths of the ocean, bringing international stories and scientific research to life on TV and digital platforms.

Since joining Euronews in 2001, he has produced hundreds of documentaries in collaboration with the European Commission, the European Space Agency, and the United Nations. Between 2007 and 2020, he covered nearly 200 EU-funded science projects for the weekly programme Futuris, working closely with the European Commission‚Äôs DG RTD, DG CNECT, and the Joint Research Centre.

In 2019, Denis launched Ocean, a cinematic documentary series produced in cooperation with the European Commission‚Äôs DG MARE. Running for 82 monthly episodes until the end of 2025, the series explores marine conservation, illegal fishing, plastic pollution, offshore energy, climate change, and deep-sea science. The project has taken him from the South Pacific to the North Pole, and from the Caribbean Sea to the Indian Ocean. All Ocean episodes are freely available in multiple languages at euronews.com/ocean.

As an international news correspondent, Denis has conducted one-on-one interviews with world leaders and key newsmakers, and has reported from conflict zones.

He holds a PhD in Information and Communication Sciences and is certified to work in hostile environments, fly paragliders, pilot drones, navigate vessels, and dive to depths of 60 metres.

tagline: Chief Diversification Officer
summary:
From Canal+ Group press release - 21 October 2025 :

CANAL+, now combined with MultiChoice, is strengthening the organizational structure of CANAL+ Africa, effective 1 November 2025.

Thomas Follin has been appointed Chief Diversification Officer, CANAL+ Africa. Previously Chief Transformation, Data & AI Officer at CANAL+, he led major structural transformations that strategically positioned the group to meet future challenges.

In his new role, he will oversee CANAL+‚Äôs overall diversification strategy across the African continent.

A graduate of the Master‚Äôs program in Telecommunications and New Media at Universit√© Paris Dauphine‚ÄìPSL, Thomas Follin began his career in 2002 at the M6 Group as a strategic mission manager. In 2008, he joined M6‚Äôs digital division as Director of New Media Channels. In 2016, he was appointed Deputy Managing Director of the M6 Group, in charge of 6play and the distribution of audiovisual channels and services, and became a member of the Executive Committee. From September 2019 to March 2023, he served as Managing Director of SALTO. He joined CANAL+ in May 2023 as Chief Transformation, Data & AI Officer.

tagline: Journalist and Filmmaker
summary:
I began my career in 2010 as a photojournalist in South Africa covering social and economic injustices.

In 2013, I went on to work with director, Yann Arthus-Bertrand, on his documentary, HUMAN.
This film captured the stories of thousands of people across 70 countries. My work subsequently took me across France and Spain, where I conducted more than 200 interviews in French, English and Spanish.
Self-taught as a filmmaker, I began to film and direct my own projects.

In 2015, I filmed and produced a 28-minute report in the USA about nomadic workers, for the streaming platform Spicee. Later that year, I joined France 24 as a reporter and went on to become the network‚Äôs Madrid correspondent.
During my stint, I reported from across Spain and Portugal including long format reports as well as breaking news.

I also reported for three other French and Belgian channels, including TF1, France 3 and RTL-TVI.

For over a decade, I have been reporting on the battle for gender equality.

In 2020, my first documentary, ‚ÄòProtect the living, Honour the Dead,‚Äô about ending violence against women in France, was first broadcast on France 24. It was selected by several international festivals, including FIGRA (France) and Toronto International Women Film Festival, and awarded multiple prizes, including Best documentary at the San Francisco Arthouse Short Festival.

Since 2022, I have been covering the war in Ukraine for France 24 and French broadcaster, LCI. Also in recent months, I have been covering the Israel-Hamas conflict and its consequences on the West Bank. 

I am currently working on my second documentary.

tagline: Award-winning freelance journalist with extensive experience in digital writing, video and field work
summary:
I'm an award-winning journalist, documentary filmmaker and writer who's passionate about finding and telling complicated, human stories through the lens of technology.

I am currently a technology reporter for Euronews, where I cover the artificial intelligence boom, mis/disinformation and fintech. Within these high level stories, I try to find a human angle wherever possible so we have a better idea of how these technological changes are impacting all of us. 

Before moving to Europe, I was an award-winning correspondent for CBC News in Canada's Arctic. I focused on telling stories about underrepresented groups and on some of the biggest issues facing our time, including deep dives into climate change and the housing crisis. I won an RTDNA, one of Canada's most prestigious awards, for that work and received seven other nominations for my documentary work.

I also have a keen interest in international relations. My career so far has given me many occasions to see how it works up close: from my view in scrums as a national reporter on Ottawa's Parliament Hill or with my seat at the table as a young Canadian diplomat in Geneva and Brussels.

Now, I'm looking to gain more international experience to prepare for my ultimate career goal of being a full-time foreign correspondent. I've already reported from several countries, including: France, Saudi Arabia, Nepal, Rwanda, Switzerland, Mexico and the United States. 

When I'm not reporting, you can find me hiking through France's beautiful country-side, learning a new language (I'm perfecting my Spanish) or volunteering.

Contact me:
Email: anna.e.desmarais@gmail.com
Twitter: @anna_desmarais
Instagram : annadesmarais

jobtitle: Mentor - INSEAD Alumni Association France - Mentoring Program
tagline: Group Marketing Director at AFP, MBA INSEAD, Certified Exec. Coach
summary:
For the past six years, I've been hiring and spearheading a growing team of 30+ marketing experts to learn and transform together - one step at a time - our marketing organization into a results-driven digital business contributor.

Our data-driven growth hacking strategies boosted by AI have led to measurable results in the digital marketing funnel, consistently generating new business opportunities and providing increasingly valuable leads to the AFP sales team.

We review our progress every quarter using OKR (Objectives and Key Results), which helps us identify areas for growth and continuously improve our performances in attracting new clients by developing new offers or retaining them with a stronger client realtionship.

With an experience spanning 20 years in the B2B media-tech sectors across Europe and Asia, I have honed my passion for digital transformation and new ventures, founding 3 startups along the way.

As a manager and certified business coach, my mission is to do my best to empower individuals to grow with passion. In addition to my professional expertise, I also volunteer my time and skills to assist individuals as a coach (all proceeds going to charities) for individuals, startup founders, or INSEAD alumni. Check testimonials here:  nicolasgiraudon.com

I hold a full-time MBA from INSEAD and have actively served on the board of the Hong Kong Alumni Association.

A committed eco-citizen, I raise environmental awareness through my blog, mypollutionfacts.com, and actively promote sustainable living initiatives.

Specialties: content licensing, business development, online news, digital distribution, media, coaching, video, digital, and ecommerce.

I also have expertise in CDN, Architecture and Video Player. I enjoy working on diverse and challenging technical projects, building and leading international and hybrid teams, and managing large-scale projects and budgets.

I worked previously as Trace Group's CTO for 8 years, with a similar scope and global footprint.

summary:
I lead Globecast's technology strategy, having guided our transformation over the last few years to an IP-centric service model, revolutionizing broadcast services, including relocation to new broadcast facilities. 

After 3 decades, Globecast has evolved away from being a teleport business to a
broadcast managed-services business that operates in multiple cloud platforms using
our networks for delivery and live broadcast/streaming operations. We are now a next-generation cloud services and OTT operations provider that has retained some of its satellite capability when needed.

With a passion for innovation, change, and launching new services in a changing media ecosystem, I take great pride in ensuring flawless service delivery for our clients who are major cable networks and national broadcasters, content producers, and streaming platforms. 

Drawing on my decades of experience in media, I am determined to ensure Globecast is the premier managed services provider worldwide.

tagline: Technical Leader
summary:
I am a seasoned technologist with over a decade of experience, holding a master's degree in Applied Mathematics from both √âcole Polytechnique in France and the National University of Singapore. Beginning my career in 2014 as a researcher in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence, I have initiated, led, and contributed to projects across Machine Learning, Back-End, Infrastructure, and Blockchain.

I have a proven track record of leading engineering teams to deliver highly complex products using cutting-edge technologies. Notable projects developed under my leadership include the Liquid Collective institutional liquid staking protocol, Kiln x Ledger on-chain staking protocol, Quorum Ethereum blockchain client, Quorum-Key-Manager secure signer, ConsenSys Orchestrate transaction orchestration system, and several smaller Machine Learning and AI projects.

summary:
Trained in philosophy (ENS Lyon) and corporate strategy (HEC Paris), I have built a career at the crossroads of strategic thinking and operational implementation.

My professional career began in the cultural field: project management in France and abroad for my show company (CIE 44), business analyst for Ekhosc√®nes, consultant for France T√©l√©visions, administrative manager for the Radio France Festival... I developed solid skills in project management, strategic analysis and management, as well as in copywriting and corporate communications, all within a variety of structures: large groups, start-ups, associations, public and private companies.

I then put these skills to work at Radio France, where I have been Chief of Staff since 2021. This experience enabled me to work in close contact with the structural challenges of the French and international cultural sector, working with a wide range of people in a complex environment.

My guiding principle: model, write and structure - to bring meaning, vision and coherence to the projects I manage.

Today, I aspire to put this cross-disciplinary expertise to work on high-impact projects at an international level where thought and action can combine to transform reality.
